channel.title: How do you login to your router (Read My Situation)
channel.description:
Ok, i have been wanting to make a runescape private server for over a year now, but, everytime i get to the portforwarding step i get lost.. and quit...
anyways, how do you login to your router if its not connected to your computer, but if its connected to another computer on the same enternet network (WIFI NETWORK) as you? or do you login to it at all, and if so, then what do i do next to make my server? just continue with whatever steps i have left? PLEASE HELP!!!!!!!!!

item.title: How do you login to your router (Read My Situation)
item.dc:creator: @Pkmasterpwnz Pkmasterpwnz
item.description:
@Pkmasterpwnz wrote:

i have an ethernet router… and i tried that hole default gateway then loggging in… but idk the password like i said the router is on another computer… could the password be like my wifi wep key? or something like that?

Read full topic

item.title: How do you login to your router (Read My Situation)
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Enter your ip address in the webbrowser bar eg: 69.149.121.53, then login with your default router/password.

i looked on that website b4… see, my router the one im connected to is an ethernet and it dont have that code thingy or whatever on that website cuz i have already searched when i tried… so do you know the thing for an ethernet router? or could u like post a link to where i can set this stuff up and stuff…

Read full topic

item.title: How do you login to your router (Read My Situation)
item.dc:creator: @john5689 john5689
item.description:
@john5689 wrote:

If you are wireless then you need to login to your router. Head to portforward.com and click on Router List, Then find your router’s name E.G Mines a Netgear DG834GT so i search that. Once you have found your router click on it and do CTRL + F and type in RuneScape. It should come up with RuneScape Private Server. Click on that and it will show you what to do

Have fun with your server

Edit:

It don’t matter how many computers are on that Router, If there is more than 1 computer on that network then you can have 2 server’s running at the same time with the same port from both computers.

Also If you are Wired then you don’t need to worry about portfowarding

Read full topic
item.source: How do you login to your router (Read My Situation)
